com.ericelsken.android.web

Class RequestManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ericelsken.android.web.RequestManager

  • public class RequestManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is a Singleton implementation that manages all instances of RequestHanlders that are used by an application. The default ExceptionHandler used by the application can be set through this class. Unless otherwise set, an instance of DefaultExceptionHandler is created and used by all RequestHanlders when this class is first created. All methods in this class MUST be called in the main-UI thread.
    Author:
    Eric Elsken

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static RequestManager getInstance()
        Returns the Singleton instance of this class.
        Returns:
        the Singleton instance of this class.

      • setExceptionHandler

        public void setExceptionHandler(ExceptionHandler handler)
        Sets the ExceptionHandler that will be used by all RequestHandlers created after this call returns.
        Parameters:
        handler - the new ExceptionHandler. A null value means no Exception handling aside from RequestCallback.onRequestException() will occur.

      • getExceptionHandler

        public ExceptionHandler getExceptionHandler()
        Returns the current default ExceptionHandler. Note that this value could be used by custom-handled Requests or outside of the Request life-cycle.
        Returns:
        the current default ExceptionHandler implementation.

      • addRequest

        public boolean addRequest(int id,
                 RequestHandler handler)
        Adds a RequestHandler to be managed by this object. If a RequestHandler is already mapped by id, then this is a no-op and false is returned. The same occurs if handler is null.
        Parameters:
        id - the id to be mapped to handler.
        handler - the RequestHandler to be mapped by id.
        Returns:
        true if handler was successfully added, false otherwise.

      • containsRequest

        public boolean containsRequest(int id)
        Returns whether or not the RequestHandler identified by id is currently being managed by this class.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the RequestHandler to query for existence.
        Returns:
        true if the RequestHandler is currently being managed by this class, false otherwise.

      • getHandler

        public RequestHandler getHandler(int id)
        Returns the RequestHandler mapped by id if it exists.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the RequestHandler to return.
        Returns:
        the RequestHandler mapped to by id if it exists, null otherwise.

      • cancelRequest

        public boolean cancelRequest(int id)
        Utility function that attempts to cancel the RequestHandler identified by the given id. If the RequestHandler is not being managed by this class, then this is a no-op and false is returned.
        Parameters:
        id - the id used to identify the RequestHandler.
        Returns:
        RequestHandler.cancel() if the RequestHandler exists, false otherwise.

      • removeRequest

        public void removeRequest(int id)
        Removes the RequestHandler identified by id if it exists.
        Parameters:
        id - the id used to identify the RequestHandler.

      • setCallback

        public void setCallback(int id,
               RequestCallbacks callback)
        Sets the RequestCallback of a RequestHandler if it exists. This is a no-op is the RequestHandler does not exist.
        Parameters:
        id - the id used to identify the RequestHandler.
        callback - the new RequestCallback to set on the RequestHandler.
